module.name: Maps
module.short: Implements a map for unique IDs to arbitrary data

descr.p: Implements a map for unique IDs to arbitrary data. The ID-to-Data mapping is stored in an Average Level Binary Tree for fast indexing. The map also maintains a linked list between the ordered items for fast iteration through its elements. The ID can be signed or unsigned, with a size of 1, 2, 4, 8, 16 or 32 bytes. The data can be of any (constant) size.
Author: Marc Weustink

element.name: TMapIdType
element.short: Identifies the data type used for map IDs

descr.p: TMapIdType is an enumeration type with values that identify the native data type used in map ID values. TMapIdType is used in TMapID and as an argument in the TBaseMap.Create method.

element.name: TMapIdType.itu1
element.short: 1 byte unsigned value (Byte)

element.name: TMapIdType.its1
element.short: 1 byte signed value (ShortInt)

element.name: TMapIdType.itu2
element.short: 2 byte unsigned value (Word)

element.name: TMapIdType.its2
element.short: 2 byte signed value (SmallInt)

element.name: TMapIdType.itu4
element.short: 4 byte unsigned value (LongWord)

element.name: TMapIdType.its4
element.short: 4 byte signed value (LongInt)

element.name: TMapIdType.itu8
element.short: 8 byte unsigned value (QWord)

element.name: TMapIdType.its8
element.short: 8 byte signed value (Int64)

element.name: TMapIdType.itu16
element.short: 16 byte unsigned value (Low and High QWords)

element.name: TMapIdType.its16
element.short: 16 byte signed value (Low QWord and High Int64)

element.name: TMapIdType.itu32
element.short: 32 byte unsigned value (4 QWord values)

element.name: TMapIdType.its32
element.short: 32 byte signed value (3 QWord values and Int64)

element.name: itsPtrSize
element.short: Constant that indicates the size of a signed Pointer in the map

descr.p: itsPtrSize is a constant TMapIdType data type that indicates the size used for a signed Pointer in the map. The definition is CPU-specific. For a 64-bit CPU, it is defined as its8 in TMapIdType (or Int64). For all other CPUs, it is defines as its4 in TMapIdType (or LongInt).
Use ituPtrSize to get the length of an unsigned Pointer in the map.
descr.remark: Not used in the current implementation.

element.name: ituPtrSize
element.short: Constant that indicates the size of an unsigned Pointer in the map

descr.p: ituPtrSize is a constant TMapIdType data type that indicates the size used for an unsigned Pointer in the map. The definition is CPU-specific. For a 64-bit CPU, it is defined as itu8 in TMapIdType (or QWord). For all other CPUs, it is defines as itu4 in TMapIdType (or LongWord).
Use itsPtrSize to get the length of a signed Pointer in the map.
descr.remark: Not used in the current implementation.

element.name: PMapItem
element.short: Pointer to a TMapItem data type

descr.p: PMapItem is a Pointer to a TMapItem data type. PMapItem is the type used to represent the first, last, previous, and next items in a linked list. PMapItem is used in TMapLink and TBaseMap.

element.name: PMapLink
element.short: Pointer to a TMapLink data type

descr.p: PMapLink is a Pointer to a TMapLink data type.
descr.remark: Not used in the current implementation.

element.name: TMapLink
element.short: Record type used to build the linked list for items in the map

descr.p: TMapLink is a record type with members that contain Pointers to the Previous and Next items in the linked list for the map. TMapLink is used to implement TMapItem.

element.name: TMapLink.Previous
element.short: Pointer to the previous item in the linked list for a map

descr.p: Previous is a PMapItem type that contains a pointer to the previous item in the linked list for a map. Values in Previous and Next are used when TBaseMap adds an item to the map, and when TMapIterator acts upon items in the linked list.

element.name: TMapLink.Next
element.short: Pointer to the Next item in the linked list for a map

descr.p: Next is a PMapItem type that contains a pointer to the Next item in the linked list for a map. Values in Previous and Next are used when TBaseMap adds an item to the map, and when TMapIterator acts upon items in the linked list.

element.name: PMapID
element.short: Pointer to a TMapID type

descr.p: PMapID is a Pointer to a TMapID type.

TMapID is a record type used to provide access to the byte values in the ID for a map association. Members are provided in TMapID to represent each byte in the signed or unsigned value used in the ID.

Values in the TMapIdType enumeration indicate which members in the variable structure are needed for the ID value. In other words, assigning an unsigned Byte value to the ID yields access to the U1 member. Assigning a signed ShortInt value to ID, yields access to the S1 member. Et. al.
The implementation for 16- and 32-byte ID values is platform- or OS-specific, and takes into account the Endian byte order for the values.
TMapID is the type used for the ID member in TMapItem.

element.name: TMapID.U1
element.short: Unsigned Byte value for the ID (1 Byte)

module.element: Signed ShortInt value for the ID (1 Byte)

element.name: TMapID.U2
element.short: Unsigned Word value for the ID (2 Bytes)

element.name: TMapID.S2
element.short: Signed SmallInt value for the ID (2 Bytes)

element.name: TMapID.U4
element.short: Unsigned LongWord value for the ID (4 Bytes)

element.name: TMapID.S4
element.short: Signed LongInt value for the ID (4 Bytes)

element.name: TMapID.U8
element.short: Unsigned QWord value for the ID (8 Bytes)

element.name: TMapID.S8
element.short: Signed Int64 value for the ID (8 Bytes)

element.name: TMapID.U16H
element.short: Unsigned QWords (Low and High) (16 Bytes) (with Endian byte order)

element.name: TMapID.S16L
element.short: Signed QWord (Low) and Int64 (High) (16 Bytes) (with Endian byte order)

element.name: TMapID.U32HH
element.short: Unsigned QWords (LL, LH, HL, HH) (32 Bytes) (with Endian byte order)

element.name: TMapID.U32HL
element.short: Unsigned QWords (LL, LH, HL, HH) (32 Bytes) (with Endian byte order)

element.name: TMapID.U32LH
element.short: Unsigned QWords (LL, LH, HL, HH) (32 Bytes) (with Endian byte order)

element.name: TMapID.U32LL
element.short: Unsigned QWords (LL, LH, HL, HH) (32 Bytes) (with Endian byte order)

element.name: TMapID.S32HH
element.short: Signed QWords (LL, LH, HL) and signed Int64 (HH) (with Endian byte order)

element.name: TMapID.S32HL
element.short: Signed QWords (LL, LH, HL) and signed Int64 (HH) (with Endian byte order)

element.name: TMapID.S32LH
element.short: Signed QWords (LL, LH, HL) and signed Int64 (HH) (with Endian byte order)

element.name: TMapID.S32LL
element.short: Signed QWords (LL, LH, HL) and signed Int64 (HH) (with Endian byte order)

element.name: TMapItem
element.short: Represents the ID and order of items in the linked list for the map

descr.p: TMapItem is a packed record type with members that represent the ID in the map, and navigation for the linked list of items. Data for the map item is written immediately following the packed record structure

element.name: TMapItem.Link
element.short: Provides navigation to the previous and next map items in the linked list

descr.p: Link is a TMapLink type which provides navigation to the previous and next map items in the linked list. Link contains Pointers to TMapItem instances that represent the order of access for items in the linked list.

element.name: TMapItem.ID
element.short: Represents the ID for the map item

descr.p: ID is a TMapID type that represents the ID for the map item. ID provides members which allow access to the byte values in the unique identifier.

element.name: TBaseMap
element.short: Implements the base class for a map for unique IDs to arbitrary data

descr.p: Implements the base class that is a map for unique IDs to arbitrary data. The ID-to-Data mapping is stored in an Average Level Binary Tree for fast indexing. The map also maintains a linked list between the ordered items for fast iteration through its elements. The ID can be signed or unsigned, with a size of 1, 2, 4, 8, 16 or 32 bytes. The data can be of any (constant) size.
Use a descendant class, such as TMap, which includes methods to Add items and to read or write their arbitrary data values.
Author: Marc Weustink

element.name: TBaseMap.FindNode
element.short: Finds a node in the AVL Tree with the specified ID

element.name: TBaseMap.FindNode.Result
element.short: AVL Tree node with the specified item

element.name: TBaseMap.FindNode.AId
element.short: ID to locate in the AVL Tree

element.name: TBaseMap.FindItem
element.short: Finds the data for the item with the specified ID

element.name: TBaseMap.FindItem.Result
element.short: Data stored in the AVL Tree for the specified ID

element.name: TBaseMap.FindItem.AId
element.short: ID to locate in the AVL Tree

element.name: TBaseMap.FreeData
element.short: Frees the data for the specified AVL Tree node

element.name: TBaseMap.FreeData.ANode
element.short: AVL Tree node to locate in the map

element.name: TBaseMap.TreeCompareID
element.short: Gets the relative order for the specified map items using their binary ID values

element.name: TBaseMap.TreeCompareID.Result
element.short: -1, 0, or 1 as the relative order for the map items

element.name: TBaseMap.TreeCompareID.Sender
element.short: AVL Tree for the operation

element.name: TBaseMap.TreeCompareID.AItem1
element.short: Map item to compare

element.name: TBaseMap.TreeCompareID.AItem2
element.short: Map item to compare

element.name: TBaseMap.IteratorAdd
element.short: Adds the map iterator to the internal list

element.name: TBaseMap.IteratorAdd.AIterator
element.short: Map iterator to add to the list

element.name: TBaseMap.IteratorRemove
element.short: Removes the map iterator from the internal list

element.name: TBaseMap.IteratorRemove.AIterator
element.short: Map iterator to remove from the list

element.name: TBaseMap.InternalAdd
element.short: Adds a map item with the specified ID and Data to the AVL Tree

descr.p: InternalAdd is a procedure used to add a map item with the specified ID and Data to the AVL Tree. InternalAdd raises an EListError exception if AId already exists in the internal AVL Tree, and no actions are performed in the method.

InternalAdd allocates and populates memory used for the TMapItem and its arbitrary data, and adds the new item to the internal AVL Tree. InternalAdd updates the pointers to the previous and next map items in the linked list.
Do not call InternalAdd directly. Use a descendant class, such as TMap, which implements the Add method.

errors.p: Raises an EListError exception when a duplicate ID is found in the AVL Tree. Raised with the message in DUPLICATE_ID.

element.name: TBaseMap.InternalAdd.AId
element.short: ID for the new map item

element.name: TBaseMap.InternalAdd.AData
element.short: Data for the new map item

element.name: TBaseMap.InternalGetData
element.short: Gets the data stored in the specified map item

descr.p: InternalGetData is a Boolean function used to get the data stored in the specified map item. AItem is the map item examined in the method, and must contain a valid pointer. The return value is set to False, and no actions are performed in the method, when AItem contains Nil. The return value is True when a pointer has been assigned to AItem.

InternalGetData skips the ID value in AItem, and stores the Data for the map item in AData. The size arguments passed in the constructor are used when reading the ID and Data values. Please note that no validation is performed for the arbitrary byte values read into AData.
Do not call InternalGetData directly. Use the public methods in the class, or a descendant class like TMap which implements the GetData method.

element.name: TBaseMap.InternalGetData.Result
element.short: True when the specified map item is a valid pointer

element.name: TBaseMap.InternalGetData.AItem
element.short: Map item to examine n the method

element.name: TBaseMap.InternalGetData.AData
element.short: Data stored in the specified map item

element.name: TBaseMap.InternalGetDataPtr
element.short: Gets a Pointer to the data for the specified map item

descr.p: InternalGetDataPtr is a function used to get a Pointer to the data for the specified map item. AItem is a Pointer to the map item examined in the method. The return value is set to Nil when AItem has not been assigned, and no actions are performed in the method.
InternalGetDataPtr sets the Pointer in the return value to the position in AItem immediately after the ID value. InternalGetDataPtr is used in the implementation of methods like Delete and FreeData.
Do not call InternalGetDataPtr directly. Use one of the public methods in the class, or a descendant class like TMap which implements the GetDataPtr method.

element.name: TBaseMap.InternalGetDataPtr.Result
element.short: Pointer to the data for the specified map item

element.name: TBaseMap.InternalGetDataPtr.AItem
element.short: Map item examined in the method

element.name: TBaseMap.InternalGetId
element.short: Get the ID value for the specified map item

descr.p: InternalGetId is a Boolean function used to get the ID value for the specified map item. AItem is a Pointer to the map item examined in the method. The return value is False if AItem has not been assigned (contains Nil), and no actions are performed in the method.
InternalGetId stores the ID value from AItem in the AID parameter. The number of bytes used for the ID is specified using a TMapIdType value in the constructor for the class.
InternalGetID is used primarily in the implementation of TBaseMapIterator and descendant classes.

element.name: TBaseMap.InternalGetId.Result
element.short: False if the specified map item is not a valid Pointer

element.name: TBaseMap.InternalGetId.AItem
element.short: Map item examined in the method

element.name: TBaseMap.InternalGetId.AID
element.short: Value for the ID in the specified map item

element.name: TBaseMap.InternalSetData
element.short: Stores the data for the specified map item

element.name: TBaseMap.ReleaseData
element.short: Frees resources allocated for the data in the map item

element.name: TBaseMap.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

element.name: TBaseMap.Clear
element.short: Clears all map items in the AVL Tree

element.name: TBaseMap.Count
element.short: Gets the number of map items in the AVL Tree

element.name: TBaseMap.Delete
element.short: Deletes the specified map item from the AVL Tree

element.name: TBaseMap.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

element.name: TBaseMapIterator
element.short: Specifies the interface used for map item iterators

element.name: TBaseMapIterator.MapDestroyed
element.short: Called when the map is destroyed

element.name: TBaseMapIterator.MapCleared
element.short: Called when the map is cleared

element.name: TBaseMapIterator.ItemRemove
element.short: Called when an Item is removed from the map

element.name: TBaseMapIterator.ItemRemove.AData
element.short: Pointer to the AVL Tree node for the item

element.name: TBaseMapIterator.InternalCreate
element.short: Initializes the iterator for specified the map

descr.p: InternalCreate is a procedure used to initialize the iterator for specified the map. InternalCreate calls the inherited Create method to create the class instance, and sets values needed for internal members in the class. The following properties are updated in the iterator:

dl.dd: Set to the first map item in the linked list
Set to True when Current is Nil
Set to True when Current is Nil

descr.p: InternalCreate is called from the Create method for the class instance.

element.name: TBaseMapIterator.InternalCreate.AMap
element.short: Map for the iterator class instance

element.name: TBaseMapIterator.InternalLocate
element.short: True when a matching map item is found

descr.p: InternalLocate is a Boolean function used to locate the specified map item in the AVL Tree for the map. AID contains a pointer to the map item and its ID and Data values. The return value is True when a matching map item is found.
InternalLocate calls ValidateMap to ensure that the map is still valid for the iterator. An EInvalidOperation is raised in ValidateMap if the structure is not assigned (contains Nil).

InternalLocate compares the map item in AId to the nodes in the AVL Tree for the map. The internal Invalid flag is set to True if a map item in the linked list has been removed, or when the map has been freed. The values in the following properties are updated to reflect the position and state for the iterator:

dl.dd: True when the item in Current is Nil
True when the item in Current is Nil
Node in the AVL Tree where the item is stored, or the value from Last when the item is not found

descr.p: Do not call InternalLocate directly. It is called from descendant classes which implement the Locate method.

element.name: TBaseMapIterator.InternalLocate.Result
element.short: True when the map item exists in the map

element.name: TBaseMapIterator.InternalLocate.AId
element.short: Map item to locate in the method

element.name: TBaseMapIterator.Validate
element.short: Validates the AVL Tree and the Current item in the iterator

descr.p: Validate is a procedure used to validate the nodes in the AVL tree for the map, and the Current item for the iterator. Validate calls ValidateMap to check the nodes in the AVL Tree. It updates the values in Current and Invalid as the nodes are processed. Validate raises an EInvalidOperation exception if the value in Current is Nil, or the Invalid flag is set.

dl.dd: Raised when Current is unassigned with the message 'No current item'.
Raised when the Invalid flag is set with the message 'Current item removed'.

element.name: TBaseMapIterator.ValidateMap
element.short: Ensures that the map for the iterator is still valid

descr.p: ValidateMap is a procedure used to ensure that the map class for the iterator is still valid. An EInvalidOperation exception is raised if the class instance is unassigned (contains Nil).

errors.p: EInvalidOperation is raised if the map class instance is unassigned (contains Nil). Raised with the message 'Map destroyed'.

element.name: TBaseMapIterator.Current
element.short: Current map item for the iterator

descr.p: Current is a read-only PMapItem property that contains a Pointer to the current map item for the iterator. The value in Current is updated in navigation methods for the iterator, such as: First, Next, Previous, Last, and Locate. The value in Current may also be updated in methods like Validate and ValidateMap.

element.name: TBaseMapIterator.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

element.name: TBaseMapIterator.First
element.short: Moves to the first item in the linked list

element.name: TBaseMapIterator.Next
element.short: Moves to the next item in the linked list

element.name: TBaseMapIterator.Previous
element.short: Moves to the previous item in the linked list

element.name: TBaseMapIterator.Last
element.short: Moves to the last item in the linked list

element.name: TBaseMapIterator.Valid
element.short: Indicates if the map for the iterator has been freed

descr.p: Valid is a Boolean function used to determine if the map for the iterator is still valid. The return value is False when the map class instance has been freed (contains Nil).

element.name: TBaseMapIterator.Valid.Result
element.short: False when the map for the iterator has been freed

element.name: TBaseMapIterator.BOM
element.short: True when the iterator is at the beginning of the linked list for the map

descr.p: BOM is a read-only Boolean property that indicates if the iterator is at the beginning of the linked list for the map, or the value in Current is Nil. The value in BOM is updated when navigation methods for the iterator are used, such as: First, Next, Previous, Last, and Locate.

element.name: TBaseMapIterator.EOM
element.short: True when the iterator is at the end of the linked list for the map

element.name: TMap
element.short: Implements a map for unique IDs to arbitrary data

descr.p: Implements a map for unique IDs to arbitrary data. The ID-to-Data mapping is stored in an Average Level Binary Tree for fast indexing. The map also maintains a linked list between the ordered items for fast iteration through its elements. The ID can be signed or unsigned, with a size of 1, 2, 4, 8, 16 or 32 bytes. The data can be of any (constant) size.
TMap extends the ancestor class to include public methods which Add map items, and read or write their arbitrary data values.
Author: Marc Weustink

element.name: TMap.Add
element.short: Adds a map item with the specified ID and Data values

element.name: TMap.Add.AId
element.short: Map item to add in the method

element.name: TMap.Add.AData
element.short: Data for the map item to add in the method

element.name: TMap.HasId
element.short: Checks for the specified ID is in the AVL Tree for the map

descr.p: HasId is a Boolean function used to locate the specified map item in the AVL Tree for the map. HasId calls the FindNode method to located the value in AId. The return value is True when FindNode returns a value other than Nil.

element.name: TMap.HasId.Result
element.short: True when the AVL Tree contains a node for the specified map item

element.name: TMap.HasId.AID
element.short: Map item to locate in the AVL Tree

element.name: TMap.GetData
element.short: Gets the Data for the map item with the specified ID

element.name: TMap.GetDataPtr
element.short: Gets a Pointer to the data for the specified map item

element.name: TMap.SetData
element.short: Stores the data for the specified map item

element.name: TMapIterator
element.short: Implements an iterator for items in a map

descr.p: TMapIterator is a TBaseMapIterator descendant that implements an iterator for items in a map. TMapIterator provides methods to initialize the iterator for a map. It also provides methods to read the IDs for map items, and to read and write the Data in map items. TMapIterator also provides an implementation of the Locate method.

element.name: TMapIterator.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

element.name: TMapIterator.Create.AMap
element.short: Map with IDs and Data for the iterator

element.name: TMapIterator.DataPtr
element.short: Gets the Pointer to the Data in a map item

element.name: TMapIterator.GetData
element.short: Gets the Data for a map item

element.name: TMapIterator.GetData.AData
element.short: Data for the map item

element.name: TMapIterator.GetID
element.short: Gets the ID for a map item

element.name: TMapIterator.Locate
element.short: Locates a map item with the specified ID

element.name: TMapIterator.SetData
element.short: Sets the Data for a map item

element.name: TTypedMap
element.short: Implements a map with support for reference counted Type Information in the Data

descr.p: TTypedMap is a TBaseMap map descendant that implements a map with support for reference counted Type Information in the Data for map items.

element.name: TTypedMap.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

element.name: TTypedMap.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

element.name: TTypedMap.GetData
element.short: Gets the Data for the specified map item

element.name: TTypedMap.GetDataPtr
element.short: Gets a Pointer to the Data for the specified map item

element.name: TTypedMap.SetData
element.short: Stores the Data for the specified map item

element.name: TTypedMapIterator
element.short: Implements an iterator for items in a map

descr.p: TTypedMapIterator is a TMapIterator descendant that implements an iterator for map items with reference counted Type Information for their Data. TTypedMapIterator provides methods to initialize the iterator for a map. It also provides methods to read the IDs for map items, and to read and write the Data in map items. TTypedMapIterator also provides an implementation of the Locate method.

element.name: TTypedMapIterator.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

element.name: TTypedMapIterator.GetData
element.short: Gets the Data for the map item

element.name: TTypedMapIterator.GetID
element.short: Gets the ID for the map item

element.name: TTypedMapIterator.Locate
element.short: Locates a map item with the specified ID

element.name: TTypedMapIterator.SetData
element.short: Stores the Data for the map item

element.name: MapReport
element.short: Gets information about the AVL Tree in the specified map

descr.p: MapReport is a String function used to get information about the AVL Tree in the specified map. The return value contains information about the order of nodes in the AVL Tree, and the pointers used in the structure. It is intended for use as a diagnostic tool.

element.name: MapReport.Result
element.short: String with the multi-line information about the AVL Tree

element.name: MapReport.AMap
element.short: Map class to examine in the routine
